Decorations on the heatmaps

Zuguang Gu ( z.gu@dkfz.de )

2020-12-18

Source: vignettes/decoration.Rmd
decoration.Rmd

In ComplexHeatmap, we use decorate_*() function to add graphics after the heatmap are drawn. To also put the decoration graphics in the heatmaps in the Shiny app, you need to wrap all the decoration code into a function and send it to post_fun argument in draw() function. For example, the following code to generate a decorated heatmap:

library(ComplexHeatmap)
m = matrix(rnorm(100), 10)
ht = Heatmap(m, name = "foo")
ht = draw(ht)
decorate_heatmap_body("foo", {
    grid.text("some text", gp = gpar(fontsize = 30))
})

To export it as a Shiny app also with decorations, the code needs to be slightly adjusted as:

library(InteractiveComplexHeatmap)
post_fun = function(ht_list) {
    decorate_heatmap_body("foo", {
        grid.text("some text", gp = gpar(fontsize = 30))
    })
}
ht = draw(ht, post_fun = post_fun)
ht_shiny(ht)

Developed by Zuguang Gu.
